info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 15 at 10:55AM PST until November 15 at 12:55PM PST by NWS San Diego CA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following county, San Diego.
* WHEN...Until 1255 PM PST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1055 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Julian, Hwy 78 Between Banner And S2, Cuyamaca Rancho State Park, Hwy 78 Between S2 And Borrego Springs Rd, Mount Laguna, I-8 Between Pine Valley And Boulevard, I-8 Between Boulevard And Imperial County Line, Hwy 79 Between Julian And Lake Cuyamaca, Lake Cuyamaca and Hwy S1 Between Lake Cuyamaca And Mount Laguna. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1255 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON
